jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Summary of Position: 
 
Account Managers will maximize revenue through the selling of digital products and course material services, including developing pilots, and selling digital textbooks at a project and enterprise level. Account Managers are responsible for driving the sales of includED and expanding the implementations of the Follett Academic Tool Suite. Account Managers will work closely with other Follett sales resources and with operations to penetrate our account base and educate our prospects for the markets in which they are responsible.
 
Specific Responsibilities:
 
   *   Develops business in conjunction with Store Operations, Regional Managers, Field Sales Managers, Campus Administrators and Faculty in person, by phone, and through correspondence to sell digital products and services. 
   *   Gathers and analyzes marketing data to find new prospects, estimate market share and to monitor the competitive landscape
   *   Analyze sales statistics to formulate sales campaigns to meet company goals. Recommend improvements to reach goals and increase profitability.
   *   Develops marketing proposals, facilitates presentations, and assist with maintenance of the account once it is established.
   *   Maintain and manage regular contact with customers
   *   Develop a trusted advisor relationship with key customer stakeholders and executive sponsors
   *   Work with publishers for content options and pricing discounts based on scale of program or potential future growth
   *   Act as liaison between customer, publisher and home office
   *   Train field operations team on key programs and initiatives
   *   Gather, prepare, and report sales data for budgeting and forecasting purposes
   *   Coordinate interdepartmental activities including scheduling and conducting meetings with sales administration staff to communicate and answer questions, resolve concerns, solicit suggestions, and discuss procedures.
   *   Participate in project committee meetings, conferences, and special assignments with senior management and other executives

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
*  Bachelor degree or equivalent in related field.
*  3-5 years experience in Education, Business, or related industry preferred.
*  Strong time management and self-management skills. 
*  Excellent oral, written and interpersonal communication skills. 
*  Ability to speak strategically about solutions oriented product.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Follett School Solutions is an industry leader providing software systems and technical solutions to K-12 school districts in the United States and throughout the world.  This position reports into the Software Architecture group which guides architecture decisions and defines quality attributes for our world class software solutions.

As a Software Architect you will empower highly motivated and dynamic software delivery teams by reducing technical roadblocks, orchestrating concurrent development tasks and defining success criteria.   Although Software Architects must focus on how software components fit into the big picture you must also have the technical skills required to "get your hands dirty" by directly working in the code as required.  Our Software Architects are recognized as strong technical experts who are able to assist and lead during implementation of high-risk or high-uncertainty software components.

You will also partner directly with product leaders and customers to build the vision for the next generation of software and solutions.  Your technical experience and judgment will be an essential component to ensure Follett Software Solutions continued success at improving education by providing world class software systems and solutions.

As a Software Architect you will:

  • Work in a dynamic Agile (Extreme Programming) and Kanban team environment.
  • Provide technical leadership through mentoring, coaching, and partnering with others at all levels of the organization.
  • Define quality attributes (Security, Performance, Extendibility, etc.) as appropriate based on the risks and role associated with each specific software system or component.
  • Assess the compliance of completed software elements with the defined quality attributes.
After ramp up time, this position could offer a partial work from home arrangement of a limited number of days per week.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field preferred.
  • 8+ years of combined experience in software architecture, design and development.
  • Strong technical competency in one or more of the following areas:
  • o Web development experience (HTML, HTML5, Javascript, CSS, client-side MV* frameworks, mobile web technologies).
  • o Demonstrated success in building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testing. Familiar with JEE Servlet/JSP, MVC pattern, ORM technologies, RESTful web services.
  • o SQL query analysis and tuning.
  • o Extensive knowledge of Web Application security, vulnerability detection and risk mitigation strategies.
  • Ability to design and communicate software architecture in an agile environment by producing efficient artifacts using UML, flowcharts or other documentation tools.
  • Experience with Sparx Enterprise Architect is a plus.
  • Ability to multi-task and provide technical oversight and architectural guidance to multiple concurrent delivery teams.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to agile, test-first software development.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software development, outgoing personality, ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to define quality attributes or non-functional requirements for software components.
  • Strong ability to evaluate software conformance to defined quality attributes and ability to recommend efficient remediation activates when deficiencies are uncovered.
  • Passion for setting delivery teams up for success by reducing complexity and clearly communicating success criteria.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Responsible for the timely and accurate processing of accounts payable documents and adherence to departmental and company policies. Provides training, assists others in resolving routine issues, and supports the supervisor. Creates documents and spreadsheets and uploads/downloads data from computer systems.
 
Specific Responsibilities:
 
* Prepare invoices for payment including matching invoices to receiving paperwork and purchase orders and obtaining authorization for payment.
* Perform detailed analysis of current and outstanding items on vendor statement such as invoices, chargeback, and credit memos/debit memos.
* Assign general ledger account numbers and validate expense to budget entries in computer system.
* Pursue collections from vendors in debit balance in accordance with company policy.
* Resolve purchase order, receipt, and invoice exceptions for accounts.
* Prepare manual checks for distribution when necessary.
* Make routine and non-recurring journal entries.
* Maintain vendor files and assist in production of 1099 forms.
* Respond to inquiries via phone/email/written correspondence from internal and external customers.
* Act as a resource to other staff regarding routine issues, erroneous accounts, and computer problems.
* Assist in the preparation and production of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and report and review for accuracy.

The candidate hired will travel to K-12 schools and school districts within an assigned geographical territory to purchase textbooks from school's excess inventory. Responsibilities include face-to-face interaction with school officials, as well as locating, purchasing, sorting, boxing and shipping of textbooks from schools/districts to corporate headquarters for processing.
 
This position requires the ability to work from a home-based office and requires travel, 20%-30%.
 
We offer a competitive compensation plan including base salary, commission, car allowance and gas reimbursement, with no limit on earning potential.
 
We estimate that first year total compensation will be between $50,000 and $65,000.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Promotes the sales of Power Cables and related products to targeted customers in the electrical and industrial markets, in order to meet or exceed approved sales budgets.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Identifies market needs, target accounts and ongoing projects in the assigned sales territory.
  • Development of new accounts to increase market
  • Actively seek out information relating to competitor products and activity in the market
  • Knows and understands our product offering and manufacturing capabilities for Power Cables and related
  • Plans and executes action plans to increase sales, meet or exceed approved sales budgets, and develop long-term customer relationships, in coordination with the Sales Manager.
  • Works with our marketing staff and the plant to develop suitable marketing and promotional materials for the
  • Calls on existing and prospective customers to promote our product offering, obtain requests for quotation, develop new business and identify product/market opportunities.
  • Develops annual sales plan in support of organization strategy and objectives.
  • Implements approved distribution strategies.
  • Manages multiple channel selling strategies.
  • Builds, develops and manages sales team capable of carrying out needed sales and service initiatives.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
The Vice President, sales position is responsible for establishing the sales targets to meet the company objectives. Responsible for developing strategic sales plans based on company goals that will promote sales growth and customer satisfaction for the organization.

The ideal candidate must have experience in Power Cables and related (T&D) transmission & distribution products. Knowledge of the electrical utility industry and/or related electrical products is a must. The individual must possess the ability to grow sales, develop relationships and support a growing customer base.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing or Business related field (MBA preferred but not required).
  • Minimum of five (5) years proven experience in sales and marketing of Power Cables or related
  • Ability to communicate effectively, orally and in writing
  • Proven sales track record within the energy cable market
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Excellent analytical and organizational skills

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Summary of Position: 
 
Performs functions to compile, update, and approve bibliographies of both print and non-print materials based on state, national and curriculum standards.  
 
Specific Responsibilities:
*  Create and maintain school leveled core lists on TITLEWAVE (company website), using the tools available such as publisher visits, sample and advanced copies of books, professional review journals and websites. 
*  Create and maintain title selection for the subscription plans for TitleEZ subscription plans by attending publisher meetings, webinars, reading review journals and/or use of internet.
*  Create and maintain title selection for specialized lists that are posted to TITLEWAVE by attending publisher meetings, webinars, reading review journals and/or use of internet.
*  Create and maintain title selection for customized selection lists based on customer needs/requests.
*  Create and maintain title selection for State and National standards for TITLEWAVE. 
*  Conduct subject searches using one or more of the appropriate search tools: key words, subject heading, Dewey Decimal classification, mainframe program utilities, and/or Boolean search statements.
* Keep abreast of library and curriculum trends through communication with customers, the Sales organization, Marketing, and Acquisitions, as well as with continuing education, attendance at trade shows, webinars, and networking.
*  Meet with publisher representatives to gather information about upcoming titles, to ensure the best and newest titles are selected for our lists.  Share information on new trends when we see a need for new titles for the school market.
*  Collaborate and work with the Acquisitions Department to ensure an adequate selection of book and audiovisual titles in all Dewey areas.
*  Assist Bibliographers during busier times in creating, updating, and/or approval of core lists for new schools, or other large order opportunities.
*  Post new lists, new titles and corrections to TITLEWAVE as needed or directed.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
*  Master of Library Science (ALA Accredited) or a Master's degree with a Library Media Certification or Endorsement is Required.
*  3 -- 5 years experience related to developing curriculum or library materials.
*  Basic knowledge of MS Office Suite, email and Internet.
*  Solid communication skills, both written and verbal. 
*  Keyboarding/mouse, calculator and typing skills.
*  Basic math skills.
*  Media Specialist certification or similar broad training preferred.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
Follett School Solutions is an industry leader providing software systems and technical solutions to K-12 school districts in the United States and throughout the world.  This position reports into the Software Architecture group which guides architecture decisions and defines quality attributes for our world class software solutions.

As a Software Architect you will empower highly motivated and dynamic software delivery teams by reducing technical roadblocks, orchestrating concurrent development tasks and defining success criteria.   Although Software Architects must focus on how software components fit into the big picture you must also have the technical skills required to "get your hands dirty" by directly working in the code as required.  Our Software Architects are recognized as strong technical experts who are able to assist and lead during implementation of high-risk or high-uncertainty software components.

You will also partner directly with product leaders and customers to build the vision for the next generation of software and solutions.  Your technical experience and judgment will be an essential component to ensure Follett Software Solutions continued success at improving education by providing world class software systems and solutions.

As a Software Architect you will:

  • Work in a dynamic Agile (Extreme Programming) and Kanban team environment.
  • Provide technical leadership through mentoring, coaching, and partnering with others at all levels of the organization.
  • Define quality attributes (Security, Performance, Extendibility, etc.) as appropriate based on the risks and role associated with each specific software system or component.
  • Assess the compliance of completed software elements with the defined quality attributes.
After ramp up time, this position could offer a partial work from home arrangement of a limited number of days per week.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field preferred.
  • 8+ years of combined experience in software architecture, design and development.
  • Strong technical competency in one or more of the following areas:
  • o Web development experience (HTML, HTML5, Javascript, CSS, client-side MV* frameworks, mobile web technologies).
  • o Demonstrated success in building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testing. Familiar with JEE Servlet/JSP, MVC pattern, ORM technologies, RESTful web services.
  • o SQL query analysis and tuning.
  • o Extensive knowledge of Web Application security, vulnerability detection and risk mitigation strategies.
  • Ability to design and communicate software architecture in an agile environment by producing efficient artifacts using UML, flowcharts or other documentation tools.
  • Experience with Sparx Enterprise Architect is a plus.
  • Ability to multi-task and provide technical oversight and architectural guidance to multiple concurrent delivery teams.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to agile, test-first software development.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software development, outgoing personality, ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to define quality attributes or non-functional requirements for software components.
  • Strong ability to evaluate software conformance to defined quality attributes and ability to recommend efficient remediation activates when deficiencies are uncovered.
  • Passion for setting delivery teams up for success by reducing complexity and clearly communicating success criteria.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
This position greets customers, assists customers with store inquiries, answers the phone and/or directs callers, tabulates purchases using the register for transactions. Use safe money handling procedures and secure transaction practices.
  • Greet customers and render assistance as necessary responding to inquiries of products and merchandise.
  • Answers phone and responds to inquiries or direct calls for appropriate resolution.
  • Operates cash register tabulating transactions, accepting payments, giving change, bagging purchases and processing employee or faculty discounts as appropriate. Starts up and shuts down register, trouble shoots, counts down register, perform cashier audits, etc.
  • Balances the cash drawer including checks and the credit card receipts and student charge slips.
  • Observes safe money handling procedures and secure transaction practices when accepting cash payment, making change, accepting checks and credit card payments, and processing refunds/buybacks. Includes cashier integrity to safeguard register and drawer deposits.
  • Test EAS security system daily and approach customers who set off EAS system investigating alarms, resolving issue and logging EAS activations.
  • Receive, sort and open, as necessary, mail. May also take outgoing mail to mailbox or Post Office.
  • Carry and shelve merchandise inventory; may also pull and package merchandise for return to vendors. Straightens merchandise, stocks shelves, prices merchandise and may assist in setting up displays and signs. May be required to mop, vacuum, clean shelves and take out trash.
  • Ensure inventory controls tags are removed and/or replaced on merchandise according to company standards as applicable.
  • Pick, process and pack orders for shipping in accordance with Retail Store Operations
  • Fill in for other employees during absences, for breaks and lunches, and during periods of high volume.
  • May perform data entry or type simple correspondence including printing and system back-up.
  • Take inventory as needed and may have responsibility for ordering general merchandise items (snacks, beverages, newspapers, magazines, etc.).
  • May provide customer service/sales functions for special events (including but not limited to author signings, graduation and athletic events)
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

  • Operates cash register tabulating transactions, accepting payments, giving change, bagging purchases and processing employee or faculty discounts as appropriate. Starts up and shuts down register, trouble shoots, counts down register, perform cashier audits, etc.
  • Balances the cash drawer including checks and the credit card receipts and student charge slips.
  • Observes safe money handling procedures and secure transaction practices when accepting cash payment, making change, accepting checks and credit card payments, and processing refunds/buybacks. Includes cashier integrity to safeguard register and drawer deposits.
  • Test EAS security system daily and approach customers who set off EAS system investigating alarms, resolving issue and logging EAS activations.
  • Receive, sort and open, as necessary, mail. May also take outgoing mail to mailbox or Post Office.
  • Carry and shelve merchandise inventory; may also pull and package merchandise for return to vendors. Straightens merchandise, stocks shelves, prices merchandise and may assist in setting up displays and signs. May be required to mop, vacuum, clean shelves and take out trash.
  • Ensure inventory controls tags are removed and/or replaced on merchandise according to company standards as applicable.
  • Pick, process and pack orders for shipping in accordance with Retail Store Operations
  • Fill in for other employees during absences, for breaks and lunches, and during periods of high volume.
  • May perform data entry or type simple correspondence including printing and system back-up.
  • Take inventory as needed and may have responsibility for ordering general merchandise items (snacks, beverages, newspapers, magazines, etc.).
  • May provide customer service/sales functions for special events (including but not limited to author signings, graduation and athletic events)
  • Perform other duties as assigned.

Follett School Solutions is an industry leader providing software systems and technical solutions to K-12 school districts in the United States and throughout the world.  This position reports into the Software Architecture group which guides architecture decisions and defines quality attributes for our world class software solutions.

As a Software Architect you will empower highly motivated and dynamic software delivery teams by reducing technical roadblocks, orchestrating concurrent development tasks and defining success criteria.   Although Software Architects must focus on how software components fit into the big picture you must also have the technical skills required to "get your hands dirty" by directly working in the code as required.  Our Software Architects are recognized as strong technical experts who are able to assist and lead during implementation of high-risk or high-uncertainty software components.

You will also partner directly with product leaders and customers to build the vision for the next generation of software and solutions.  Your technical experience and judgment will be an essential component to ensure Follett Software Solutions continued success at improving education by providing world class software systems and solutions.

As a Software Architect you will:

  • Work in a dynamic Agile (Extreme Programming) and Kanban team environment.
  • Provide technical leadership through mentoring, coaching, and partnering with others at all levels of the organization.
  • Define quality attributes (Security, Performance, Extendibility, etc.) as appropriate based on the risks and role associated with each specific software system or component.
  • Assess the compliance of completed software elements with the defined quality attributes.
After ramp up time, this position could offer a partial work from home arrangement of a limited number of days per week.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology or related field preferred.
  • 8+ years of combined experience in software architecture, design and development.
  • Strong technical competency in one or more of the following areas:
  • o Web development experience (HTML, HTML5, Javascript, CSS, client-side MV* frameworks, mobile web technologies).
  • o Demonstrated success in building high-performance Java systems, performance tuning, and stress and load testing. Familiar with JEE Servlet/JSP, MVC pattern, ORM technologies, RESTful web services.
  • o SQL query analysis and tuning.
  • o Extensive knowledge of Web Application security, vulnerability detection and risk mitigation strategies.
  • Ability to design and communicate software architecture in an agile environment by producing efficient artifacts using UML, flowcharts or other documentation tools.
  • Experience with Sparx Enterprise Architect is a plus.
  • Ability to multi-task and provide technical oversight and architectural guidance to multiple concurrent delivery teams.
  • Demonstrate a commitment to agile, test-first software development.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, energy and passion for software development, outgoing personality, ability to work in a team environment.
  • Ability to define quality attributes or non-functional requirements for software components.
  • Strong ability to evaluate software conformance to defined quality attributes and ability to recommend efficient remediation activates when deficiencies are uncovered.
  • Passion for setting delivery teams up for success by reducing complexity and clearly communicating success criteria.

jobRequisitionOverrides.requisitionDescription:
Responsible for the timely and accurate processing of accounts payable documents and adherence to departmental and company policies. Provides training, assists others in resolving routine issues, and supports the supervisor. Creates documents and spreadsheets and uploads/downloads data from computer systems.
 
Specific Responsibilities:
 
* Prepare invoices for payment including matching invoices to receiving paperwork and purchase orders and obtaining authorization for payment.
* Perform detailed analysis of current and outstanding items on vendor statement such as invoices, chargeback, and credit memos/debit memos.
* Assign general ledger account numbers and validate expense to budget entries in computer system.
* Pursue collections from vendors in debit balance in accordance with company policy.
* Resolve purchase order, receipt, and invoice exceptions for accounts.
* Prepare manual checks for distribution when necessary.
* Make routine and non-recurring journal entries.
* Maintain vendor files and assist in production of 1099 forms.
* Respond to inquiries via phone/email/written correspondence from internal and external customers.
* Act as a resource to other staff regarding routine issues, erroneous accounts, and computer problems.
* Assist in the preparation and production of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and report and review for accuracy.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
* Works on routine activities and tasks.
* Follows established standards and procedures for processing and prioritizing work.
* Duties and tasks are standardized.
* Resolves routine questions and problems and works on problems of limited scope.
* Learns and applies knowledge of basic tasks. Applies basic or general skills and procedures.
* Uses and follows established and standard procedures to perform tasks.
* Receives substantial guidance from manager.
* Errors and actions affect the immediate group.
* Works under close-to-sometimes-moderate supervision of manager.
* Novice level with minimal training.
* Knows basic procedures and processes.
* Has approximately 1-3 years' experience.

jobRequisitions.requisitionDescription:
The candidate hired will travel to K-12 schools and school districts within an assigned geographical territory to purchase textbooks from school's excess inventory. Responsibilities include face-to-face interaction with school officials, as well as locating, purchasing, sorting, boxing and shipping of textbooks from schools/districts to corporate headquarters for processing.
 
This position requires the ability to work from a home-based office and requires travel, 20%-30%.
 
We offer a competitive compensation plan including base salary, commission, car allowance and gas reimbursement, with no limit on earning potential.
 
We estimate that first year total compensation will be between $50,000 and $65,000.

positionQualifications.qualificationSummary:
* Should possess at least 1-3 years of field sales experience with a proven track record of success. Previous K-12 experience is a plus.
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required.
* Able to lift up to 50 lbs for an 8 hr day
* Intermediate computer skills (Word and Excel) 
* Able to provide reliable transportation and have a valid driver's license
* Willing and able to complete extensive road travel
